ingredients: 250g Paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cut into 1-inch cubes
1 large bell pepper (capsicum), cut into 1-inch squares
recipe: 1. In a large bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. Add ginger-garlic paste, all powdered spices, salt, and lemon juice. Mix well. 2. Add the paneer cubes, onion, and bell pepper to the marinade. Gently toss to coat everything evenly. 3. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. 4. Thread the marinated paneer and vegetables onto skewers. 5. Preheat a grill or tawa. Cook the skewers, turning occasionally and basting with oil, until all sides are golden brown and charred. 6. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

ingredients: For Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup ghee, 1/2 tsp salt, water

For Filling: 4 medium potatoes (boiled, peeled, mashed), 1 cup green peas (boiled), 1 small onion (finely chopped), 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt
recipe: 1. Prepare the dough by mixing flour, salt, and ghee. Add water gradually to knead a firm dough. Cover and rest for 30 minutes. 2. For the filling, heat oil, add cumin seeds. Sauté onion and ginger. Add all powdered spices, then mashed potatoes and peas. Mix well and let it cool. 3. Divide dough into balls. Roll into an oval and cut in half. Form a cone, stuff with filling, and seal the edges. 4. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry samosas on low-medium heat until golden and crisp.

1. In a bowl, combine sliced onions, salt, and all spices. Mix and let it rest for 10 minutes for onions to release water. 2. Add gram flour and rice flour. Mix well, adding a little water only if necessary to form a thick batter that coats the onions. 3. Heat oil. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil. 4. Fry on medium heat until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with tamarind chutney.

1. Squeeze excess water from the spinach. 2. In a bowl, mix spinach, mashed peas, grated potatoes, breadcrumbs, roasted gram flour, ginger, chilies, and spices. 3. Combine to form a firm mixture. Divide and shape into flat, round patties. 4. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the kebabs on both sides until crisp and golden brown.

ingredients: For Batter: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup cornflour, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp black pepper, salt
For Sauce: 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp chili sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tsp chopped ginger, 1 tsp chopped garlic, 1 spring onion (chopped)
recipe: 1. Blanch cauliflower florets in hot salted water for 5 minutes. Drain. 2. Prepare a thick batter with flour, cornflour, ginger-garlic paste, pepper, and salt. Coat the florets and deep fry until golden and crisp. 3. For the sauce, heat oil in a pan, sauté ginger and garlic. Add soy sauce, chili sauce, and vinegar. 4. Add the fried cauliflower to the sauce and toss to coat. Garnish with spring onions.

1. Drain the boiled corn completely. 2. In a bowl, mix cornflour, rice flour, pepper, chili powder, and salt. Add the corn and toss until well-coated. 3. Deep fry the coated corn in hot oil until golden and crispy. Drain on a paper towel. 4. In a separate pan, lightly sauté the chopped onion and bell pepper. 5. Add the crispy corn to the pan, toss well, and serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 cups hung curd (thick yogurt, water drained)
recipe: 1. In a bowl, gently mix hung curd, grated paneer, roasted gram flour, onion, ginger, green chilies, and coriander. 2. Season with salt and pepper. The mixture should be thick. 3. Lightly grease your palms, take a portion of the mixture, and shape it into a small patty. 4. Heat oil in a non-stick pan and carefully shallow fry the kebabs on low-medium heat until both sides are golden brown.

1. Ensure the mashed potatoes are dry and free of lumps. 2. In a bowl, combine mashed potatoes with breadcrumbs, cornflour, ginger paste, green chilies, all spices, and coriander. 3. Mix well to form a dough. Divide and shape into round, flat patties. 4. Heat oil on a tawa or pan. Shallow fry the tikkis on medium heat, pressing them slightly, until they are crisp and golden brown on both sides.

ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into 1.5-inch cubes
recipe: 1. In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tandoori masala, chili powder, turmeric, salt, lemon juice, and mustard oil to make a marinade. 2. Add the chicken pieces and mix until they are fully coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight for best results. 3. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Thread the chicken onto skewers. 4. Place skewers on a baking tray and bake for 15-20 minutes, turning once, until cooked through and charred at the edges.

ingredients: 1 large onion, finely chopped and squeezed dry
recipe: 1. In a food processor, combine the minced meat, onion, ginger-garlic paste, chilies, coriander, and all spices. Pulse until the mixture is fine and well combined. 2. Transfer to a bowl, add the roasted gram flour, and mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. 3. Wet your hands, take a portion of the mixture, and press it around a skewer, shaping it into a long kebab. 4. Grill on a barbecue or in an oven, turning frequently and basting with butter, until cooked through and browned.

ingredients: 500g firm white fish fillets (like Kingfish or Cod), cut into pieces
For Marinade: 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, salt
For Batter: 1 cup gram flour (besan), 2 tbsp rice flour, 1 tsp ajwain (carom seeds), 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt
recipe: 1. First, marinate the fish pieces with lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and salt for 20 minutes. 2. In a separate bowl, prepare the batter by mixing gram flour, rice flour, ajwain, and all spices. Add water gradually to make a thick, smooth batter. 3. Dip each marinated fish piece into the batter, ensuring it's well-coated. 4. Deep fry in hot oil on medium heat until the fish is cooked through and the batter is golden and crisp.

1. Marinate the prawns with turmeric, chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, pepper, and salt. Let it sit for 30 minutes. 2. Lightly coat the marinated prawns with rice flour. 3. Heat oil in a wide pan. Place the prawns in a single layer without overcrowding. 4. Pan-fry on medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes on each side, until they turn pink, curl up, and are cooked through. Do not overcook.

ingredients: 1/2 cup chana dal (split Bengal gram), soaked for 1 hour
1 tsp black peppercorns, 2 cloves, 1 black cardamom
recipe: 1. In a pressure cooker, add the minced mutton, soaked chana dal, onion, ginger, garlic, and all whole spices with 1 cup of water. Cook for 15-20 minutes until the meat is tender and the water has evaporated. 2. Cool the mixture and grind it to a fine, smooth paste without adding water. 3. Add the egg and chopped coriander to the paste and mix well. 4. Shape the mixture into round, flat patties. 5. Heat ghee in a pan and shallow fry the kebabs until they are crisp and dark brown on both sides.

ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into small pieces
For Marinade: 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tbsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 egg, 2 tbsp cornflour, 2 tbsp rice flour, salt
For Tempering: 2 tbsp oil, 6-8 curry leaves, 4 green chilies (slit)
recipe: 1. In a bowl, mix the chicken pieces with all the marinade ingredients to form a thick coating. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. 2. Deep fry the marinated chicken pieces in hot oil until they are cooked, red, and crispy. Drain and set aside. 3. In another pan, heat 2 tbsp of oil. Add the curry leaves and green chilies and sauté for a minute. 4. Add the fried chicken pieces to the tempering, toss well, and serve immediately.

ingredients: For Batter: 1 egg, 3 tbsp cornflour, 1 tsp black pepper, salt
For Sauce: 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp red chili sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tbsp chopped garlic, 1 tbsp chopped ginger
1 large bell pepper, cut into squares
recipe: 1. Coat the chicken cubes in a batter made of egg, cornflour, pepper, and salt. Deep fry until golden and crisp. 2. In a wok or pan, heat oil and sauté the ginger and garlic. 3. Add the onion petals and bell pepper squares and stir-fry on high heat for 2 minutes. 4. Add the soy sauce, chili sauce, and vinegar. Stir well. 5. Add the fried chicken to the sauce and toss quickly to coat everything. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 whole chicken (about 1 kg), skin removed and cut into quarters
For Marinade: 1 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 3 tbsp tandoori masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tbsp mustard oil, salt
A few drops of red food coloring (optional)
recipe: 1. Make deep gashes on the chicken pieces. Apply a mix of lemon juice, chili powder, and salt, and set aside for 30 minutes. 2. Prepare the main marinade by mixing yogurt with all the remaining ingredients. 3. Coat the chicken pieces thoroughly with this marinade, ensuring it gets into the gashes. Refrigerate for at least 6-8 hours. 4. Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F). Place the chicken on a grill rack and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through, basting with butter occasionally.

ingredients: 1 cup whole black lentils (sabut urad dal)
recipe: 1. Soak lentils and kidney beans overnight. Pressure cook them until very soft and mushy. 2. In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat butter. Sauté the onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add the tomato puree, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates from the masala. 4. Add the cooked lentils and beans to the pan. Mash them slightly. Add water to adjust consistency and let it simmer on low heat for at least 30 minutes. 5. Stir in the heavy cream just before serving. Garnish with a dollop of butter.

ingredients: 1 large bunch of spinach (palak), blanched and pureed
recipe: 1. Heat oil/ghee in a pan. Add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add the chopped onion and sauté until golden. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add the chopped tomato and cook until soft. 3. Add turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the masala releases oil. 4. Add the spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes. 5. Add the paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for another 5 minutes. 6. Stir in the cream before turning off the heat. Serve hot.

ingredients: For Chole: 1 cup chickpeas (soaked overnight), 1 onion (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp chole masala, 1 tea bag (for color)
For Bhature: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp baking soda, salt, water
recipe: 1. For Chole: Pressure cook the soaked chickpeas with the tea bag and salt until tender. In a pan, sauté onion, then add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Add chole masala and cook. Finally, add the boiled chickpeas and simmer. 2. For Bhature: Knead a soft dough with flour, yogurt, sugar, baking soda, salt, and water. Let it rest for 2-3 hours. 3. Roll out portions of the dough into ovals and deep fry in hot oil until they puff up and turn golden brown. 4. Serve the hot bhature with the chole.

ingredients: For Kofta: 200g paneer (grated), 2 large potatoes (boiled, mashed), 2 tbsp cornflour, salt, pepper, chopped nuts (optional)
For Gravy: 2 onions (paste), 1 cup tomato puree, 1/4 cup cashew paste, 2 tbsp cream, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala
recipe: 1. For Kofta: Mix grated paneer, mashed potatoes, cornflour, salt, and pepper. Shape into small balls, stuffing with nuts if desired. Deep fry until golden brown. 2. For Gravy: Heat oil, sauté the onion paste until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, then tomato puree. Add all powdered spices and cook until oil separates. 3. Stir in the cashew paste and cook for a few minutes. Add water for desired consistency and bring to a simmer. 4. Finish the gravy with cream and garam masala. To serve, place the koftas in a bowl and pour the hot gravy over them.

1. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds. When they crackle, add the sliced onions and sauté until translucent. 2. Add ginger paste and cook for a minute. Add the chopped tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft. 3. Add the potato cubes and cauliflower florets. Stir well to coat with the masala. 4. Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender. Garnish with fresh coriander.

1. Roast the eggplant directly over a flame or in the oven until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. Let it cool, then peel the skin and mash the pulp. 2. Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the onions until golden brown. 3. Add the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for a minute. 4. Add the chopped tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are mushy and oil separates. 5. Add the mashed eggplant and mix well. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. 6. Finish with garam masala and garnish with coriander.

ingredients: 500g okra (bhindi), trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
recipe: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the okra pieces until they are cooked and slightly crisp. Remove and set aside. 2. In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed. Add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add the chopped tomato and cook until soft. 4. Add all the powdered spices (turmeric, coriander, chili, amchur) and salt. Cook for 2 minutes. 5. Add the fried okra back to the pan and mix gently to coat with the masala. Cook for another 5 minutes on low heat.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, cauliflower)
For Gravy: 1 onion (paste), 1/2 cup cashew paste, 1/4 cup yogurt, 1/4 cup cream, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, whole spices (bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves), 1/2 tsp garam masala
recipe: 1. Boil or steam the mixed vegetables until tender. Lightly fry the paneer cubes, cashews, and raisins. 2. Heat oil, add whole spices. Sauté onion paste until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 3. Lower the heat, add whisked yogurt and cook until oil separates. 4. Stir in the cashew paste and cook for a few minutes. Add a little water, salt, and bring to a simmer. 5. Add the boiled vegetables, paneer, nuts, and raisins. Simmer for 5 minutes. 6. Finish with cream and garam masala.

ingredients: For Gravy: 1 kg ripe tomatoes, 50g cashews, 2 tbsp butter, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp Kashmiri red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 2 tbsp honey or sugar, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1 tbsp dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi)
recipe: 1. Blanch and puree the tomatoes with the cashews to make a smooth paste. 2. Heat butter in a pan. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté. Add the tomato-cashew puree, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 15-20 minutes until the gravy thickens. 3. Strain the gravy through a sieve for a silky smooth texture. 4. Return the gravy to the pan. Add the chicken tikka pieces, garam masala, and honey/sugar. Simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Finish with heavy cream and crushed kasuri methi.

ingredients: 4 tbsp Kashmiri red chili powder (made into a paste with water)
Whole spices: 2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, 4 green cardamoms, 1 black cardamom, 1-inch cinnamon stick
recipe: 1. Heat mustard oil until it smokes, then cool slightly. Add whole spices. Sauté the chopped onion until deep golden brown. 2. Add the mutton pieces and brown them on high heat. 3. Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Lower the heat, add the whisked yogurt and stir continuously. Then add the red chili paste, fennel powder, and ginger powder. 5. Add 2 cups of hot water and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat for 1-1.5 hours, or until the mutton is tender and the gravy is thick and red.

ingredients: For Masala Paste: 1 cup grated coconut, 5-6 dried red chilies, 1 tsp coriander seeds, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 4-5 peppercorns, small ball of tamarind
recipe: 1. Grind all the masala paste ingredients with a little water to a very smooth paste. 2. Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the onion until translucent. 3. Add the ground masala paste and cook for 5-7 minutes until the raw smell disappears and oil starts to separate. 4. Add 2 cups of water and salt. Bring the curry to a boil. 5. Gently slide in the fish pieces. Simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Do not over-stir.

ingredients: For Marinade: 1 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, salt
For Gravy: 2 large onions (thinly sliced and deep-fried until crisp), 1/2 cup cashew paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala
Whole spices: bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves
recipe: 1. Marinate the chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and salt for at least 1 hour. 2. Crush the fried onions (birista). 3. Heat ghee, add whole spices. Add the marinated chicken and cook on high heat for 5-7 minutes. 4. Add the powdered spices, crushed onions, and cashew paste. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes. 5. Add 1 cup of water, cover, and simmer on low heat for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is tender and the gravy is creamy. Finish with garam masala.

ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 mins
For Marinade: 1 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tbsp red chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 cup fried onions (birista), 1/2 cup chopped mint, 1/2 cup chopped coriander, juice of 1 lemon
Whole spices, saffron soaked in milk, ghee
recipe: 1. Marinate the meat with all the marinade ingredients and let it rest for at least 4 hours. 2. Par-boil the soaked basmati rice with whole spices until it's 70% cooked. Drain. 3. In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer the marinated meat at the bottom. Top it with a layer of the par-boiled rice. 4. Sprinkle the saffron milk, remaining fried onions, mint, and a few spoonfuls of ghee on top. 5. Cover the pot with a tight lid and seal the edges with dough (dum cooking). Cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes. Let it rest before opening.

1. Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Sauté onions until golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add the tomato puree and all powdered spices. Cook until oil separates. 3. Add the minced meat and cook on high heat, breaking up lumps, until it's browned. 4. Add the green peas and 1 cup of water. Season with salt. 5. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes (for chicken) or 30-40 minutes (for mutton) until the meat is cooked and the gravy has thickened. Finish with garam masala.

ingredients: For Gravy: 2 large onions (chopped), 3 tomatoes (pureed), 1/4 cup cashew paste, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/4 cup cream, kasuri methi
recipe: 1. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add tomato puree and powdered spices. Cook until oil separates. 3. Stir in the cashew paste and cook for a few minutes. 4. Add 1.5 cups of water and bring to a simmer. 5. Add the chicken tikka pieces and cook for 10 minutes. 6. Finish with cream, crushed kasuri methi, and garam masala.

ingredients: 10-15 dried red Mathania chilies, soaked and ground to a paste
Whole spices: cloves, black peppercorns, cinnamon
recipe: 1. Heat mustard oil. Add whole spices, then the sliced onion. Fry until deep brown. 2. Add the mutton and brown it. Add garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add the red chili paste and cook for 5 minutes. 4. Whisk the yogurt and add it to the pot, stirring constantly. 5. Add 2 cups of hot water and salt. Cover and cook on low heat for 1.5-2 hours until mutton is very tender and the gravy is fiery red.

1. In a bowl, mix flour and salt. Add yogurt and mix well. 2. Gradually add warm water to knead a soft, pliable dough. Cover and rest for 30 minutes. 3. Divide the dough into balls. Roll out each ball into a circle. 4. Cook on a hot tawa, then directly on the flame using tongs until it puffs up and gets charred spots. Brush with ghee or butter.

ingredients: 2 tbsp melted butter, plus more for brushing
recipe: 1. Activate yeast in warm milk with sugar. 2. In a bowl, mix flour, salt, baking soda. Add the yeast mixture, yogurt, and melted butter. Knead into a soft dough. 3. Cover and let it rise for 2 hours. 4. Punch down the dough, divide into balls. Roll into a teardrop shape. 5. Cook on a hot tawa or in a preheated oven until it puffs up and gets golden spots. Brush generously with butter.

1. Follow the recipe for Butter Naan to prepare the dough. 2. When rolling out the naan, sprinkle minced garlic and chopped coriander on top and press it in gently. 3. Cook as per the Butter Naan instructions. 4. Brush with more butter (can be garlic-infused butter) before serving.

1. Knead a soft dough with flour, salt, and water. Rest for 20 minutes. 2. Roll out a dough ball into a very thin circle. Spread ghee all over the surface. 3. Sprinkle some dry flour. Start pleating the circle like a fan. 4. Once pleated, roll it up into a tight spiral. Press it flat. 5. Roll out the spiral into a paratha. Cook on a hot tawa with ghee until both sides are golden brown and the layers are visible.

1. In a bowl, mix both flours with all the other ingredients (except ghee). 2. Add water gradually to knead a firm dough. 3. Divide into balls and roll them out into rotis. 4. Cook on a hot tawa, applying ghee on both sides, until cooked and golden brown.

1. Knead a very soft and elastic dough using both flours, milk, salt, and warm water. Rest for 1 hour. 2. Divide into small balls. Roll them out as thin as possible into large circles. 3. Traditionally cooked on an inverted, hot wok (kadhai). Cook for a minute on each side until done. 4. Fold it like a handkerchief (rumal) while it's still hot.

1. Rinse the basmati rice thoroughly until the water runs clear. Soak for 30 minutes. 2. Drain the rice. In a pot, add the rice, water, and salt. 3. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to the lowest setting. Cover with a tight lid and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed. 4. Fluff with a fork before serving.

1. Heat ghee in a pot. Add the bay leaf and cumin seeds. Let them sizzle. 2. Add the drained soaked rice and sauté gently for 2 minutes. 3. Pour in the hot water and add salt. 4. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat for 15-20 minutes until cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander.

ingredients: Whole spices: bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves
recipe: 1. Heat ghee, add whole spices. Sauté the sliced onion until golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add the mixed vegetables and sauté for 3-4 minutes. 4. Add the drained rice and mix gently. 5. Pour in water or stock, add salt, and bring to a boil. Cover and cook on low heat until rice is done and vegetables are tender.

1. Heat ghee, add cumin seeds and whole spices. Sauté the onion until golden. 2. Add the green peas and cook for 2 minutes. 3. Add the drained rice and sauté gently. 4. Pour in hot water, add salt, and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer on low heat until the rice is fluffy and cooked.

ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed fruits (pomegranate seeds, apple chunks)
A pinch of saffron soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
recipe: 1. Cook the basmati rice until it's 90% done. Drain and set aside. 2. Heat ghee in a pan, fry the nuts until golden. Remove and keep aside. 3. In the same ghee, add the cooked rice, saffron milk, fennel powder, and salt. Mix gently. 4. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes. 5. Garnish with the fried nuts and fresh fruits just before serving.

ingredients: For Tempering: 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp chana dal, 1 tsp urad dal, 2 tbsp peanuts, 2 dried red chilies, 8-10 curry leaves, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
recipe: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds. When they pop, add chana dal, urad dal, and peanuts. Fry until golden. 2. Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds. 3. Add turmeric powder, then turn off the heat. 4. Pour this tempering over the cooked rice. Add salt and lemon juice. 5. Mix everything gently until the rice is evenly yellow. Garnish with coriander.

ingredients: For Syrup: 2 cups sugar, 1.5 cups water, 4 green cardamoms, a few saffron strands
Ghee or oil for deep frying
recipe: 1. For Syrup: Boil sugar and water until the syrup is slightly sticky. Add cardamom and saffron. Keep it warm. 2. For Jamuns: Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda. Rub in the ghee. Add milk little by little to form a soft, smooth dough. 3. Make small, crack-free balls from the dough. 4. Heat ghee/oil on low heat. Fry the balls, stirring gently, until they are golden brown all over. 5. Immediately drop the fried jamuns into the warm sugar syrup. Let them soak for at least 2 hours.

ingredients: For Sugar Syrup: 1 cup sugar, 4 cups water
For Rabri (sweetened milk): 1 litre full-fat milk, 1/2 cup sugar, a pinch of saffron, chopped pistachios and almonds
recipe: 1. Make chena by curdling boiling milk with lemon juice. Drain and knead the chena until smooth. Make small, flat discs. 2. Boil sugar and water to make a thin syrup. Cook the chena discs in the boiling syrup for 10-12 minutes until they double in size. 3. For Rabri: Boil 1 litre of milk until it reduces to half. Add sugar, saffron, and nuts. Let it cool. 4. Squeeze the excess syrup from the cooked discs and drop them into the chilled rabri. Refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

1. In a heavy-bottomed pan, combine the grated carrots and milk. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until all the milk is absorbed. This will take about 40-50 minutes. 2. Add the ghee and sauté for 10-15 minutes until the carrots are well-cooked and the raw smell is gone. 3. Add the sugar and cook until the moisture from the sugar evaporates and the halwa thickens. 4. Stir in the crumbled khoya and chopped nuts. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients: For Jalebi: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tbsp gram flour, 1 tsp yeast, warm water
For Syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, pinch of saffron
recipe: 1. Prepare a smooth, thick batter with flour, gram flour, yeast, and water. Let it ferment in a warm place for 1-2 hours. 2. Prepare a one-string consistency sugar syrup with sugar, water, and saffron. 3. Heat ghee in a flat pan. Pour the batter into a squeeze bottle or piping bag. Squeeze the batter in circular motions into the hot ghee. 4. Fry until crisp and golden on both sides. 5. Immediately dip the fried jalebis in the warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds. Serve hot with chilled rabri.

1. In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until the milk has reduced to about half its original volume. 2. Add the sugar, milk powder, saffron, and cardamom powder. Stir well until everything is dissolved. 3. Continue to simmer for another 10 minutes until the mixture is thick like condensed milk. 4. Stir in the chopped nuts. Let the mixture cool down completely. 5. Pour into kulfi molds and freeze for at least 8 hours or until set.

ingredients: 1 cup yellow moong dal, soaked for 4 hours
recipe: 1. Drain the soaked moong dal and grind it to a coarse paste without adding water. 2. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add the moong dal paste. 3. Cook on low heat, stirring continuously, for about 25-30 minutes, until the dal is grainy, aromatic, and changes color to golden brown. 4. In a separate pot, heat milk, water, and sugar until the sugar dissolves. 5. Pour the hot milk-sugar mixture into the cooked dal paste carefully. Stir continuously to avoid lumps. 6. Cook until the halwa thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan. Stir in cardamom powder and nuts.

ingredients: For Gravy: 4 large tomatoes, 1 onion, 10-12 cashews, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp butter, 1 tsp Kashmiri red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/4 cup cream, 1 tbsp kasuri methi
recipe: 1. Blanch tomatoes, onion, and cashews. Grind to a smooth paste. 2. Heat butter in a pan. Add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for a minute. 3. Add the ground paste, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the gravy thickens and releases butter. 4. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a simmer. Add the paneer cubes. 5. Simmer for 5 minutes. Finish with garam masala, cream, and crushed kasuri methi.

ingredients: For Kadai Masala: 1 tbsp coriander seeds, 4-5 dried red chilies, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp fennel seeds
For Gravy: 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 onion (chopped), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
recipe: 1. Dry roast the kadai masala ingredients and grind them into a coarse powder. 2. In a pan, sauté the cubed onion and bell pepper until slightly cooked but still crunchy. Remove and set aside. 3. In the same pan, heat oil. Sauté the chopped onion until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 4. Add tomato puree and cook. Add the ground kadai masala and salt. 5. Add the paneer and the sautéed vegetables. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.

ingredients: For Gravy: 2 onions (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp garam masala
recipe: 1. Lightly fry the paneer cubes until golden and set aside. 2. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add tomato puree and all powdered spices (except garam masala). Cook until oil separates. 4. Add the green peas and 1.5 cups of water. Bring to a boil and simmer until peas are tender. 5. Add the fried paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for another 5 minutes.

1. Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Sauté onion until golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add tomato puree and powdered spices. Cook until the masala thickens and releases oil. 4. Add the mushrooms and mix well to coat with the masala. 5. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are cooked and have released their water. 6. Uncover and cook for a few more minutes until the gravy reaches the desired consistency. Finish with garam masala.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables, cut into batons (carrots, beans, bell peppers, cauliflower)
recipe: 1. Blanch the vegetables (except bell peppers) until they are tender-crisp. 2. Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the sliced onion and bell peppers on high heat for 2 minutes. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste. Add tomato puree, ketchup, vinegar, and all powdered spices. Cook for 3-4 minutes. 4. Add the blanched vegetables and stir-fry on high heat for 5 minutes, ensuring the vegetables are coated in the sauce but remain crunchy.

ingredients: 1 cup toor dal (arhar dal), washed and soaked
For Tadka (Tempering): 2 tbsp ghee, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 dried red chilies, 1 small onion (chopped), 1 tsp chopped garlic, a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
recipe: 1. Pressure cook the soaked dal with turmeric, salt, and 3 cups of water until soft and mushy. 2. For the tadka, heat ghee in a small pan. Add cumin seeds, asafoetida, and dried red chilies. 3. When the seeds splutter, add the chopped onion and garlic. Sauté until golden brown. 4. Pour this hot tempering over the cooked dal. Mix well and simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (potato, carrot, peas, beans, cauliflower)
recipe: 1. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add tomato puree and powdered spices. Cook until oil separates from the masala. 3. Add the mixed vegetables and 1 cup of water. Season with salt. 4. Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender. 5. Stir in coconut milk or cream for a richer gravy. Finish with garam masala.

1. Heat oil, sauté onions until deep golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook. Add tomato puree, chana masala powder, chili powder, and amchur. Cook until the masala is thick and aromatic. 3. Add the boiled chickpeas along with some of the water they were boiled in. Mash some of the chickpeas to thicken the gravy. 4. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld. Garnish with coriander and onion rings.

1. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add tomato puree and all powdered spices. Cook until the masala releases oil. 3. Add the boiled rajma along with its cooking water. Mash some beans to thicken the gravy. 4. Season with salt and simmer on low heat for at least 20-30 minutes for the flavors to deepen. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients: For Marinade: 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp tandoori masala
For Gravy: 2 onions (paste), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1/4 cup cashew paste, 1/4 cup cream
recipe: 1. Boil the soya chaap sticks to soften them. Remove from sticks and cut into pieces. Marinate for 30 minutes. 2. Pan-fry or deep-fry the marinated chaap pieces until golden. 3. Prepare a gravy similar to Paneer Butter Masala, using onion paste, tomato puree, and cashew paste. 4. Add the fried soya chaap pieces to the gravy and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Finish with cream and kasuri methi.

1. Heat oil, add whole spices (optional). Sauté onions until deep golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste. Add the chicken pieces and brown them on high heat. 3. Add the powdered spices and cook for a minute. 4. Lower the heat and add the whisked yogurt, stirring continuously. 5. Add the tomato puree and salt. Cook until oil separates. 6. Add 1.5 cups of hot water, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until chicken is tender. Finish with garam masala.

1. Make small slits on the boiled eggs. Lightly fry them in a little oil until they have a pale golden skin. Set aside. 2. In the same pan, prepare a gravy by sautéing onions, adding ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and powdered spices. 3. Cook the masala until oil separates. Add 1.5 cups of water and bring to a simmer. 4. Add the fried eggs to the gravy and simmer for 10 minutes. Finish with garam masala.

ingredients: For Gravy: 2 onions (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1/4 cup cashew paste, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/4 cup cream
Spices: red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala
recipe: 1. Prepare fish tikka by marinating fish chunks in a yogurt-spice mix and grilling them. 2. Prepare a creamy, tomato-based gravy similar to Chicken Tikka Masala. 3. Gently add the cooked fish tikka pieces to the simmering gravy. 4. Cook for just 5-7 minutes, being careful not to break the fish. Finish with cream and coriander.

1. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add all powdered spices and cook the masala well. 3. Add the prawns and cook for 3-4 minutes until they turn pink. 4. Pour in the coconut milk, season with salt, and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Do not overcook the prawns.

ingredients: Coarsely ground Kadai Masala (coriander seeds, red chilies, cumin)
recipe: 1. Heat oil, sauté the cubed onion and bell pepper until slightly charred. Remove and set aside. 2. In the same pan, brown the chicken pieces. Add ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add the tomato puree and the ground kadai masala. Cook until oil separates. 4. Add a little water, cover, and cook until the chicken is tender. 5. Add back the sautéed onion and bell pepper. Mix and cook for 5 more minutes.

ingredients: Spices: red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric
Whole spices: bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon
recipe: 1. Heat oil, add whole spices. Fry the sliced onions until deep brown. 2. Add the mutton pieces and sear on high heat. Add ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add the powdered spices and yogurt. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, until the oil separates. This is the 'bhuna' process. 4. Add a splash of water, cover, and cook on low heat until the mutton is extremely tender and the masala is thick and clinging to the meat.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed lentils (toor, masoor, chana), soaked
recipe: 1. Pressure cook the mutton, lentils, and vegetables together with ginger-garlic paste and salt until everything is very soft. 2. Blend the mixture to a thick, porridge-like consistency. 3. In a separate pan, prepare a tempering with oil, cumin, and onions. Add the Dhansak masala and cook. 4. Pour the blended dal-meat mixture into the tempering. Add tamarind pulp and jaggery/sugar to balance the flavors. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with caramelized brown rice.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe: 1. Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chili flakes and sauté for a minute until aromatic. 2. Add the prawns to the pan in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until the prawns are pink and cooked through. 4. Turn off the heat, stir in the lemon juice and fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 large onions (1 finely chopped, 1 cut into petals)
Spices: red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric
recipe: 1. Heat oil, sauté the finely chopped onion until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add the chicken and brown it. Add powdered spices and yogurt. Cook until oil separates. 3. Add tomato puree and cook. Add water and simmer until chicken is tender. 4. In a separate pan, sauté the onion petals until translucent. 5. Add the sautéed onion petals to the chicken curry and cook for another 5 minutes.

ingredients: Marinade: 1 cup yogurt, fried onions, mint, coriander, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala
recipe: 1. Marinate mutton for at least 6 hours or overnight. 2. Par-boil rice until 70% cooked. 3. Layer the marinated mutton and par-boiled rice in a heavy-bottomed pot. 4. Top with saffron milk, ghee, and more fried onions. 5. Seal the pot and cook on low heat (dum) for 45-60 minutes until the mutton is tender and the rice is fragrant and fully cooked.

ingredients: For Chettinad Masala: dried red chilies, coriander seeds, cumin, fennel, peppercorns, star anise, grated coconut
recipe: 1. Dry roast all the Chettinad masala ingredients (including coconut) until aromatic and grind to a paste with a little water. 2. Heat oil, add curry leaves. Sauté onion until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add the ground Chettinad masala paste and cook until oil separates. 4. Add the chicken pieces and coat well with the masala. Add water, cover, and cook until the chicken is tender.

1. Boil, peel, and prick the baby potatoes. Deep fry them in mustard oil until golden brown and crisp on the outside. 2. In a pan, heat some oil, add asafoetida and whole spices. 3. Lower the heat and add the whisked yogurt, stirring continuously. 4. Add the red chili powder, fennel powder, and ginger powder. Cook until the gravy thickens. 5. Add the fried potatoes and 1 cup of water. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until the gravy is absorbed by the potatoes.

ingredients: For Stuffing: 1/2 cup roasted gram flour, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp amchur (dry mango powder), salt
recipe: 1. Wash and dry the okra. Slit each one lengthwise without cutting through. 2. Mix all the stuffing ingredients together. Add a teaspoon of oil to make it a crumbly mixture. 3. Carefully stuff this masala mixture into the slit okra. 4. Heat oil in a wide pan. Arrange the stuffed okra in a single layer. 5. Cook on low heat, covered, for 15-20 minutes, turning them carefully in between, until the okra is tender and cooked.

1. Thoroughly wash and chop all the greens. Pressure cook them with a little water and salt until very soft. 2. Blend the cooked greens to a coarse paste. Add the maize flour and mix well to avoid lumps. 3. Cook this mixture on low heat for 20-30 minutes until it thickens. 4. For the tempering (tadka), heat ghee, sauté onions until golden, add ginger-garlic paste. Pour this over the saag. Serve hot with a dollop of white butter and Makki di Roti.

1. Soak the lentils overnight. Pressure cook until very soft. 2. In a heavy-bottomed pan, combine the cooked dal, tomato puree, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, butter, and salt. 3. Bring to a simmer and cook on very low heat for at least 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally, until the dal is creamy and thick. The slow cooking is key. 4. Before serving, stir in the cream. Garnish with more butter.

ingredients: For Kolhapuri Masala: dried red chilies, coriander seeds, sesame seeds, dried coconut, peppercorns, cloves
recipe: 1. Dry roast all the Kolhapuri masala ingredients and grind to a fine powder. 2. Boil the mixed vegetables until tender-crisp. 3. Heat oil, sauté onion. Add tomato puree and the ground Kolhapuri masala. Cook until aromatic. 4. Add the boiled vegetables and a little water. Simmer for 10 minutes. The gravy should be thick and spicy.

ingredients: For Gravy: 2 onions (boiled and pureed), 1/2 cup cashew paste, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1/4 cup cream
Spices: white pepper powder, cardamom powder, a pinch of saffron
recipe: 1. Heat ghee, add the onion puree and cook without browning. 2. Add the cashew paste and cook for a few minutes. 3. Whisk the yogurt and add it to the pan, stirring continuously. 4. Add water to get the desired consistency. Season with salt, white pepper, and cardamom powder. 5. Add the paneer cubes and saffron. Simmer gently for 5 minutes. 6. Finish with cream.

ingredients: 2 large onions, sliced and fried crisp (birista)
2 tbsp wheat flour (atta), made into a slurry
recipe: 1. Heat ghee, add the mutton shanks and brown them. Add ginger-garlic paste and Nihari masala. 2. Add the yogurt and half of the fried onions. Cook for 10 minutes. 3. Add 4-5 cups of hot water and salt. Pressure cook for 45-60 minutes until the meat is falling off the bone. 4. Open the cooker, let it simmer. Gradually add the wheat flour slurry, stirring to avoid lumps, to thicken the gravy. 5. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve hot, garnished with the remaining fried onions, ginger juliennes, and lemon.

ingredients: 1 whole leg of mutton (raan), about 1-1.5 kg
Marinade: 1 cup yogurt, 3 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, juice of 2 lemons, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, paste of almonds and cashews
recipe: 1. Clean the leg of mutton and make deep incisions all over. 2. Apply a preliminary marinade of ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt. Let it rest for 1 hour. 3. Prepare the second marinade with yogurt, nut paste, and all the spices. Coat the leg of mutton thoroughly, rubbing the marinade into the incisions. 4. Refrigerate and marinate for at least 8 hours, preferably overnight. 5. Slow-roast in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 2-3 hours, basting with ghee, until the meat is completely tender and cooked through.

ingredients: For Kulcha: 2 cups all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking soda
For Stuffing: 3-4 boiled potatoes (mashed), chopped onion, pomegranate seeds, spices
recipe: 1. Prepare a soft dough for the kulcha and let it rest. 2. Prepare the potato stuffing by mixing all the ingredients. 3. Take a ball of dough, flatten it, place a portion of the stuffing in the center, and seal it. 4. Roll it out into a kulcha. Cook in a tandoor or on a tawa until crisp and golden. 5. Brush with a generous amount of butter and serve immediately with spicy chole.

ingredients: 500g very fine minced mutton (passed through the grinder 3 times)
A unique blend of over 100 spices (potli ka masala), including rose water, saffron, and cardamom
recipe: 1. Mix the fine minced meat with the raw papaya paste and let it rest for 4-5 hours to tenderize. 2. Add the fried onion paste, ginger-garlic paste, roasted gram flour, and the secret spice blend to the meat. 3. Mix everything thoroughly until it forms a smooth, pasty dough. The mixture will be very soft. 4. Shape into small patties and shallow fry on a tawa with ghee on low heat until both sides are dark brown and cooked. Handle very gently as they are extremely delicate.

ingredients: A specific blend of spices including black cardamom, cloves, and rose petals
recipe: 1. Marinate the fine mince with papaya paste for 2-3 hours. 2. Add khoya, ginger-garlic paste, and the special spice blend to the meat. Mix and grind again to a very smooth paste. 3. Apply the mixture onto skewers in a long, thin shape. 4. Grill carefully on a charcoal grill, basting with ghee, until cooked and slightly browned. They are known for their soft, melt-in-the-mouth texture.

ingredients: Spices: coriander powder, red chili flakes, garam masala
recipe: 1. In a large bowl, mix the minced meat with all the other ingredients. Knead well as if you are kneading dough. This helps in binding. 2. Let the mixture rest for 30 minutes. 3. Wet your hands and shape the mixture into large, flat, irregular-shaped patties. 4. Shallow fry in hot oil or animal fat on a large flat pan or tawa until both sides are dark brown and crisp.

ingredients: Marinade: 1/2 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp raw papaya paste, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, salt
recipe: 1. Marinate the mutton cubes in the mixture of yogurt, papaya paste, ginger-garlic paste, and all the spices. 2. Let it marinate overnight in the refrigerator for the meat to become tender. 3. Thread the mutton pieces onto skewers. 4. Grill over charcoal or in an oven, turning occasionally and basting with ghee, until the mutton is tender, cooked through, and has a nice char on the outside.

ingredients: For Parotta: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 egg, 1 tbsp sugar, salt, milk/water, oil
For Chicken Curry: 500g chicken, 1 cup coconut milk, onion, tomato, ginger-garlic, curry leaves, spices (turmeric, chili, coriander)
recipe: 1. For Parotta: Knead a very soft, elastic dough. Let it rest. Roll out very thin, create layers by pleating and coiling, then roll again and cook on a tawa with oil. 2. For Curry: Prepare a basic chicken curry with a base of onion, tomato, and spices. Finish by adding thick coconut milk for the authentic Malabar flavor. 3. Serve the flaky, hot parottas with the fragrant chicken curry.

ingredients: For Appam: 1 cup raw rice (soaked), 1/4 cup cooked rice, 1/2 cup grated coconut, 1 tsp yeast, 1 tbsp sugar
For Stew: 2 cups mixed vegetables, 1.5 cups thin coconut milk, 1/2 cup thick coconut milk, whole spices (cinnamon, cloves, cardamom)
recipe: 1. For Appam: Grind soaked rice, cooked rice, and coconut to a smooth batter. Add yeast and sugar, and let it ferment overnight. 2. For Stew: Cook vegetables in thin coconut milk with whole spices until tender. Add salt. Finish with thick coconut milk, but do not boil after adding it. 3. To make appams, pour a ladleful of batter into a special curved pan (appachatti), swirl it around to create a lacey edge, cover and cook until the center is soft and spongy.

ingredients: For Pesarattu: 1 cup whole green moong dal (soaked overnight), 1-inch ginger, 2 green chilies
For Chutney: 1/4 cup chopped ginger, small ball of tamarind, 4-5 dried red chilies, jaggery, salt
recipe: 1. For Pesarattu: Grind the soaked moong dal with ginger and green chilies to a smooth batter. Add salt. The batter does not need fermentation. 2. For Chutney: Grind all the chutney ingredients together to a smooth paste. 3. Make thin crepes (like dosas) from the batter on a hot tawa. Optionally, sprinkle with chopped onions. 4. Serve the hot, crispy pesarattu with the spicy and tangy ginger chutney.

ingredients: For Dosa Batter: 2 cups rice, 1/2 cup urad dal (soaked and fermented)
For Masala Filling: 4 large potatoes (boiled, mashed), 1 onion (sliced), mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric
recipe: 1. Prepare the dosa batter by soaking rice and dal, grinding them, and letting the batter ferment overnight. 2. For the filling, prepare a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves. Sauté onions. Add turmeric and the mashed potatoes. Mix well. 3. Heat a tawa, spread a thin layer of the dosa batter to make a crepe. Drizzle oil. 4. When the dosa is crisp and golden, place a spoonful of the potato masala in the center and fold the dosa. Serve with sambar and coconut chutney.

ingredients: For Idli: 2 cups idli rice, 1 cup urad dal (soaked, ground, and fermented batter)
For Sambar: 1 cup toor dal, 1 cup mixed vegetables (drumstick, pumpkin, carrots), small ball of tamarind, 2 tbsp sambar powder
recipe: 1. For Idli: Grease idli molds and pour the fermented batter into them. Steam for 10-12 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. 2. For Sambar: Pressure cook the toor dal. In a pot, cook the vegetables with tamarind water and sambar powder. Add the cooked dal and simmer. Prepare a tempering of mustard seeds, curry leaves, and asafoetida and add it to the sambar. 3. Serve the soft, fluffy idlis with hot sambar.

ingredients: For Vada: 4 potatoes (boiled, mashed), ginger-garlic paste, mustard seeds, turmeric
Dry garlic chutney, green chutney, tamarind chutney
recipe: 1. Prepare the potato filling for the vada by making a tempering and mixing it with the mashed potatoes. Shape into balls. 2. Make a thick batter with gram flour. Dip the potato balls in the batter and deep fry until golden. 3. Slit a pav bun, apply the different chutneys on the inside. Place a hot vada in the center, press gently, and serve.

ingredients: For Bhaji: 4 cups mixed vegetables (potatoes, cauliflower, peas, carrots), 2 onions (chopped), 3 tomatoes (chopped), 2 tbsp pav bhaji masala, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
recipe: 1. Boil and mash all the vegetables. 2. In a large pan, melt butter. Sauté onions until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 3. Add the pav bhaji masala and cook. 4. Add the mashed vegetables, salt, and some water. Mash everything together in the pan and simmer for 15-20 minutes. 5. Serve the hot bhaji garnished with butter, chopped onions, and coriander. Serve with pav buns that have been toasted with butter.

ingredients: For Stuffing: 4 potatoes (boiled, mashed), 3 tbsp dabeli masala, tamarind chutney
For Garnish: roasted peanuts, pomegranate seeds, sev (fine gram flour noodles)
recipe: 1. Prepare the stuffing by mixing mashed potatoes with dabeli masala and tamarind chutney in a pan. 2. Slit the pav buns. Apply tamarind chutney on one side and garlic chutney on the other. 3. Fill the pav with the potato stuffing. 4. Garnish the sides of the dabeli by rolling it in sev, peanuts, and pomegranate seeds. Toast the dabeli on a tawa with butter before serving.

ingredients: For Tempering: mustard seeds, curry leaves, sesame seeds, grated coconut
recipe: 1. Whisk gram flour, yogurt, water, ginger-chili paste, turmeric, and salt to a smooth, lump-free batter. 2. Cook this batter in a pan on low heat, stirring continuously, until it becomes very thick. 3. Quickly spread this hot mixture very thinly onto greased plates or a clean countertop. 4. Let it cool for 5-10 minutes. Cut into wide strips and roll them up tightly. 5. Prepare a tempering and pour it over the rolls. Garnish with coconut.

ingredients: 1 tsp Eno fruit salt or baking soda
For Tempering: oil, mustard seeds, green chilies, curry leaves, sugar, water
recipe: 1. Make a thick batter with besan, yogurt, water, ginger-chili paste, turmeric, and salt. Let it rest for 20 minutes. 2. Just before steaming, add the Eno fruit salt and mix gently. 3. Pour the batter into a greased steaming tin and steam for 15-20 minutes. 4. Let it cool slightly and cut into squares. 5. Prepare a tempering with oil, mustard seeds, chilies, and curry leaves. Add water and sugar and let it boil. Pour this syrup over the dhoklas.

ingredients: For Fafda: 2 cups gram flour, ajwain, papad khar (alkali), oil
A side of raw papaya chutney (sambharo)
recipe: 1. For Fafda: Knead a tight dough with gram flour and other ingredients. Take a small portion, place it on a wooden board, and drag it with the base of your palm to create a long, thin strip. 2. Deep fry these strips until they are crisp. 3. Serve the crispy, salty fafda with sweet, syrupy jalebis and a tangy papaya chutney for a classic Gujarati breakfast experience.

1. Rinse the poha in a strainer until it softens, then let it drain. 2. Heat oil, fry the peanuts until crisp and set them aside. 3. In the same oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent. 4. Add turmeric, the drained poha, salt, and sugar. Mix gently. 5. Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes. 6. Turn off the heat, add lemon juice, and garnish with the fried peanuts and fresh coriander.

1. Dry roast the semolina in a pan until it's aromatic and lightly colored. Set aside. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. 3. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft. Add vegetables if using. 4. Pour in the hot water and bring to a rolling boil. Add salt. 5. Lower the heat and slowly add the roasted semolina, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. 6. Cover and cook on low heat for 5-7 minutes until the upma is thick and cooked through.

ingredients: 1 cup sago (sabudana), soaked for 4-5 hours and drained
recipe: 1. Ensure the soaked sabudana is dry to the touch and the pearls are separate. Mix it with the crushed peanuts, salt, and a little sugar. 2. Heat ghee, add cumin seeds and green chilies. 3. Add the boiled potato cubes and sauté for a minute. 4. Add the sabudana-peanut mixture and cook on medium heat, stirring gently, for 5-7 minutes until the sabudana pearls turn translucent. 5. Turn off the heat and stir in the lemon juice.

ingredients: Spices: turmeric, red chili powder, asafoetida
recipe: 1. In a bowl, mix all the ingredients (except oil) together. 2. Add a little water if needed to knead a soft dough. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into thin circles (rotis). 4. Cook on a hot tawa with a little oil on both sides until golden brown spots appear. They are soft and can be stored for a couple of days.

ingredients: For Litti: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1 cup sattu (roasted gram flour) for stuffing, pickle masala, mustard oil
For Chokha: 1 large eggplant, 2 large tomatoes, 4 potatoes (all roasted), chopped onion, garlic, green chilies, mustard oil
recipe: 1. For Litti: Prepare a firm dough. For the stuffing, mix sattu with spices, pickle masala, and mustard oil. Stuff the dough balls with this mixture. Traditionally, these are roasted over a charcoal fire, but can also be baked in an oven. 2. For Chokha: Peel the roasted vegetables and mash them together. Mix in chopped onion, garlic, chilies, salt, and a generous amount of pungent mustard oil. 3. To serve, dip the hot littis in melted ghee and serve with the chokha.
